metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    About this Document



Report an Error / Correction

Request to Use this Document

Contact

CHEMICALS

mdma

Follow @Erowid on Instagram!

MDMA

Health

by Erowid

WARNINGS:

Dangerous Interaction : MAOIs. Do not take MDMA if you are currently taking prescription MAOIs. MAOIs are most commonly found in the prescription anti-depressants Nardil (phenelzine), Parnate (tranylcypromine), Marplan (isocarboxazid), Eldepryl (l-deprenyl), and Aurorix / Manerix (moclobemide). Ayahuasca also contains MAOIs (harmine and harmaline). MDMA and MAOIs are a potentially dangerous combination.

Dangerous Interaction: Protease Inhibitors. Avoid taking MDMA if you are currently using the protease inhibitor Ritonavir. This may be a life-threatening combination. See Case Report: Interaction between MDMA and Ritonavir (Norvir).


                    Context: 
                    This section appears in Erowid's MDMA Health page, immediately following site navigation and contact information, and introduces critical health warnings about dangerous drug interactions, particularly with MAOIs and protease inhibitors, for those researching MDMA's risks and safety considerations.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    Dangerous overheating. MDMA use can lead to hyperthermia (overheating) especially in those who are exerting themselves for long periods of time. It is important for users to pay attention to their bodies and make sure they aren't overheating. Take breaks from dancing. Step outside for a moment if the temperature in the room is high. Make sure to drink enough, but not too much, water.

Individual sensitivity varies widely. A small percentage of users seem to react with extreme sensitivity to MDMA and experience overly strong effects at normal doses, including hyponatremia, unconsciousness, seizures, and other serious medical problems.

Stimulant combinations can be dangerous. Avoid other strong stimulants in combination with MDMA, which can increase heart rate, blood pressure, and body temperature risks.


                    Context: 
                    This passage is from Erowid’s MDMA Health Warnings section, outlining specific acute health risks associated with MDMA use, including overheating, sensitivity variations, and dangers of combining MDMA with other stimulants.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    Stimulant combinations can be dangerous. Avoid other strong stimulants in combination with MDMA, which can increase heart rate, blood pressure, and body temperature risks.

Water Poisoning. Some ecstasy users overreact to the overheating and dehydration issue by obsessively over-drinking. When drinking large amounts of water it's important to mix in sports drinks or salty snacks to avoid the very real dangers of water poisoning and hyponatremia (low salt), which can cause serious health problems including death. MDMA can cause changes in the body's antidiuretic hormone, leading to much higher susceptibility to hyponatremia. Drink water, but don't drink too much.

Seizures. A small number of MDMA users have reportedly had seizures after taking moderate amount of pure MDMA, more common in smaller women and with higher doses. See References Search: MDMA Seizure and Experience Search: MDMA & seizure.

CAUTIONS:


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears in Erowid’s “MDMA Health” page, within the “Warnings” section detailing major health risks and dangers of MDMA use. It specifically discusses the dangers of combining MDMA with other stimulants, the risks of water poisoning and hyponatremia from over-drinking, and reports of seizures linked to MDMA. The information directly precedes the “Cautions” section, emphasizing acute adverse effects and safety concerns for users.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    CAUTIONS:

Health Condition Contraindications. Individuals with a history of heart ailments, high blood pressure, aneurism or stroke, glaucoma, hepatic (liver) or renal (kidney) disorders, or hypoglycemia may be at higher risk.

Hyponatremia. Some users seem particularly sensitive to MDMA's effects on the antidiuretic hormone (ADH, aka Vasopressin) which can lead to serious or even fatal hyponatremia, even without ingesting too much water. See References Search: MDMA & hyponatremia.

Neurotoxicity Risk of long term changes to serotonin increases with dose and frequency of use. Though complex, people who use very high doses, re-dose repeatedly, or take MDMA frequently could experience mild, but persisting reductions in certain types of verbal memory or a mild increase in depressive symptoms. See MDMA Neurotoxicity.

May worsen depression. MDMA use can exacerbate depression in some users and cause depressions with heavy or frequent use.


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears under the "CAUTIONS" section of Erowid's MDMA Health page, immediately following a list of "WARNINGS." It highlights specific health risks and contraindications associated with MDMA use, such as pre-existing medical conditions, risk of hyponatremia, potential neurotoxicity, and worsening of depression, as part of a broader overview of MDMA's health-related dangers, interactions, and purity issues.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    May worsen depression. MDMA use can exacerbate depression in some users and cause depressions with heavy or frequent use.

MDMA & Erectile Dysfunction Drugs. Special consideration should be taken when combining MDMA & Viagra.

Crashing after peak. MDMA use can cause severe crashes after the peak effects wane, resulting in depressed mood, crying, and extreme lethargy in some users.

Hangover. MDMA can cause hangovers in some users lasting between 1 and 7 days.

Frequent use may worsen symptoms. Avoid high doses and frequent use. Over the last 15 years, many studies have shown that the higher the dose and more frequent the use, the worse the long term after-effects may be.


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is part of the "Health" section on Erowid's MDMA information page, specifically detailing health cautions and potential negative after-effects of MDMA use, such as depression, interactions with erectile dysfunction drugs, post-use crashes, hangovers, and the risks associated with high doses or frequent use.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    PURITY ISSUES: One of the primary problems with MDMA is the low quality of the material sold on the street to recreational users. Tablets of street "ecstasy" frequently contain an assortment of psychoactive substances, either mixed with MDMA, or in place of it, or may contain no active ingredients at all. Other substances found in street ecstasy include MDA, MDE, PMA, caffeine, ephedrine, amphetamines, DXM, and occasionally DOB. Caffeine, ephedrine, and amphetamines will produce less empathic effects than MDMA with more stimulation and feelings of restlessness. MDA and MDE are both similar in effects to MDMA and it may be difficult for even experienced users to distinguish between them. MDE is slightly shorter in duration than MDMA and generally has a lower peak and less euphoria than MDMA. MDA lasts longer and generally produces more visuals and psychedelic effects than MDMA. The effects of DXM, which has become more common in street ecstasy, can be extremely unpleasant if you're not


                    Context: 
                    This section appears within a comprehensive overview of MDMA health risks and cautions, specifically addressing the issue of street "ecstasy" purity. It discusses the common adulterants and substitutes found in illicit MDMA tablets, their differing effects, and the risks associated with misidentified or contaminated substances.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    MDA lasts longer and generally produces more visuals and psychedelic effects than MDMA. The effects of DXM, which has become more common in street ecstasy, can be extremely unpleasant if you're not expecting them: strong disorientation, dizziness, nausea, grogginess or strong sedation, and at high enough doses, dissociation from the body. For further information on the contents of laboratory tested Ecstasy pills...see EcstasyData.org or Ecstasy.org.


                    Context: 
                    This passage is part of a section discussing the common adulterants and purity issues with street "ecstasy" (MDMA), describing how substances like MDA, MDE, and DXM are often found in ecstasy tablets, their differing effects, and where to find laboratory testing information.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the health effects of MDMA, including contraindications.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    DEATHS:

Rachel Clute (April 10, 2012), 19, died of "anoxic encephalopathy due to toxic effects of methamphetamine and ecstasy" according to the Honolulu Medical Examiner's Office. [HawaiiNewsNow, Star Advertiser]

A paper documented 202 deaths in England and Wales associated with Ecstasy between 1996 and 2002. Only 17% of these had "ecstasy" (MDMA, MDA, MDE, or PMA) as the sole drug involved. (Schifano et al. 2003)

An examination of ecstasy-related deaths in Florida found at least 7 were caused by PMA and not MDMA/MDA/MDE. See Ecstasy Deaths in the State of Florida: A Post-Mortem Analysis (Goldberger et al. 2002)

References Search: MDMA & Death

Coroner's Report: Anna Victoria Wood (1995)

Britney Chambers (January 3 2001)

Morgan Jones (April 1995)

How risky is ecstasy? - Newcombe & Woods, 1999

Can ecstasy kill? - TheSite.org

List of MDMA-Related Death Case Reports, TheDEA.org

DEPRESSION:

Ecstasy may unearth hidden depression - Feb 24 2006


                    Context: 
                    This section presents documented cases and statistics related to deaths associated with MDMA (commonly known as ecstasy), highlighting individual fatalities, research studies, and reports that analyze the causes and contributing factors to ecstasy-related mortality. It follows broader discussions about MDMA health risks, dangerous interactions, and purity issues, and precedes a section addressing the drug's potential to trigger or worsen depression.
